title: Stop buffing Zac.
body:
No one likes it when this non-stop gank machine is meta and no one likes being initiated on from way off the screen. The blob man singlehandedly makes immobile champions unviable whenever he's picked.

Edit: I'd like to point out to all the people talking about Zac's winrate that the new patch has him at 53% already. http://lolalytics.com/champion/Zac/Jungle/

Stupid blob man is busted again. Thanks Riot.

You're not supposed to have every gank paths warded in the first place, regardless of what jungler it is.
Against stealth junglers and Zac, and to some degree Hecarim (lumping together because you often can't see them ganking you until it's too late), a good way to ward is putting the ward in one of the camps. River bush (the one in the river, not the long one next to the lane; just a generally good place for wards, but it also lets you see if they're doing scuttle) and raptor camp is relatively safe to ward.

That said, Zac is hard to ward against, and that is one of his intended strengths.

Zac isn't even that bad. Then again I'm biased because I play him, but he's not cancerous at all if you play against him, IMO. You're complaining about the fact that he's played like he's supposed to, which is to counter immobile champions. Zac isn't too mobile in the sense of dashes, actually, but in the sense that he has the ability to cover large distances very quickly. His kit was built around the fact that he's able to do this, and he's naturally good against immobile champions because they can't avoid his long range small AOE cc. His counterplay is much more linear than someone like lee sin, who if they miss their q can just wardhop to you, kick you into their mid, have their q up and fuck you over, or {{champion:113}}, who perma slows you and has 2 stuns and a knockup to make sure you never escape anything.
